Events that occurred on 30 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1952 - Translator Helmut W. Pesch born.
1964 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 261.
1964 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to L. Sprague de Camp.
1968 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 305a.
1973 - J.R.R. Tolkien goes to a birthday party for Jocelyn Tolhurst, wife of Denis Tolhurst.
1981 - The twenty-sixth and last episode of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
1992 - The 1992 radio series of Smith of Wootton Major is aired on BBC Radio 5.
2012 - Tolkien Calendar 2013 is published.
2018 - The Fall of Gondolin is published.
2018 - Tolkien Calendar 2019 is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
